adult.name: template1

The Education is {education}. The Work hours per week is {hours_per_week}.

heart.name: template1
heart.instruction: Does the coronary angiography of this patient show a heart disease? Answer 1 if the patient shows a heart disease and 0 otherwise. Do not answer other than simply 1 or 0. Do not explain why.

The patient's serum cholesterol is {chol} mm/dl. The patient's fasting blood sugar is {fbs} than 120 mg/dl. The resting electrocardiogram results is {restecg}. The patient's maximum heart rate is {maxhr}. The exercise-induced angina is {exang}. The ST depression induced by exercise relative to rest is {oldpeak}. The slope of the peak exercise ST segment is {slope}.

bank.name: template1
bank.instruction: The data is related with direct marketing campaigns of a Portuguese banking institution. The marketing campaigns were based on phone calls. Often, more than one contact to the same client was required, in order to access if the product (bank term deposit) would be (or not) subscribed. Overall about 30% of the clients do subscribe to a term deposit. Do you believe the following client will subscribe a term deposit? Answer 1 if you believe the client will subscribe and 0 otherwise. Do not answer other than simply 0 or 1. Do not explain why.
